sections.About: The course treats measure theory and the Lebesgue integral. The Lebesgue integral is more general than the Riemann integral, and it is an important tool in modern analysis since it is easier to integrate limits of functions. Integrals with respect to general measures play an important role in many areas of mathematics and its applications, for example in probability theory and potential theory. The course is one of the first you will take as a graduate student in mathematics.
sections.Entry requirements: Knowledge equivalent to 90 credits in mathematics.
sections.Selection: All eligible applicants who have applied before the deadline will be granted a place.
